oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Temperature on the Cannibalistic Behavior of Bacillus subtilis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NANDY, SK
PRASAD, V
VENKATESH, KV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sporulating bacteria
climate-change
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bacillus subtilis resorts to cannibalism to delay sporulation under severe nutritional limitation. We report the effect of temperature on the dynamics of cannibalism demonstrated by B. subtilis. A model consisting of a delay differential equation may explain the effect of temperature on the dynamics of cannibalism.
